radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal heart size without pericardial effusion. No central pulmonary embolus. Bi-apical scarring minimal. Bibasilar atelectasis small. Small right-sided Bochdalek hernia containing fat. Lungs are clear without nodule or focal consolidation. The liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands are unremarkable. Thickened hyperemic appendix with surrounding fluid collection indicating likely perforation, and significant phlegmonous change in the right lower quadrant.
